The Data

September 25, 1813
Sequence Lat, Long Place Description Observed Commentary Source
1 51.5160914, -0.1444061 Queen Anne Street, Cavendish Square, London Home of Henry Herbert Southey, used by Robert Southey during his stays in London Coleridge dined here yesterday, in good health & spirits. Robert Southey to Edith Southey

September 28, 1813
Sequence Lat, Long Place Description Observed Commentary Source
2 51.5160914, -0.1444061 Queen Anne Street, Cavendish Square, London Home of Henry Herbert Southey, used by Robert Southey during his stays in London When I returned to Q Anne Street from the visit I found Davy sitting with the Doctor, & awaiting my return. Robert Southey to Edith Southey

November 11, 1813
Sequence Lat, Long Place Description Observed Commentary Source
3 51.502291, -0.202689 Holland House home of the Hispanist Lord Holland, and a centre for Whig political, social and cultural life [Ed. RS dined at Holland House] Robert Southey to Mary Barker

November 16, 1813
Sequence Lat, Long Place Description Observed Commentary Source
4 51.5164, -0.097722 Bull and Mouth Bull and Mouth, an inn from which coaches and wagons left for Cumbria Before my departure I dined with Gooch. Aldermanbury being conveniently near the Bull & Mouth. Robert Southey to Herbert Hill
5 51.429531, -0.131538 Streatham Home from 1810 of Southey’s uncle Herbert Hill, his wife and children. Southey and his family were frequent visitors when in London. I was sorry to leave Streatham, & think the more seriously of moving southward because I liked so well. Robert Southey to Herbert Hill

November 18, 1813
Sequence Lat, Long Place Description Observed Commentary Source
6 51.502291, -0.202689 Holland House home of the Hispanist Lord Holland, and a centre for Whig political, social and cultural life Mackintosh has brought back from India a diseased liver, & a reputation which I do not think he will be able to support either in Parliament, or in his xx intended historical labours. I met him at Holland House, & at Madam de Staels. Robert Southey to William Taylor

January 24, 1814
Sequence Lat, Long Place Description Observed Commentary Source
7 51.5164, -0.097722 Bull and Mouth Bull and Mouth, an inn from which coaches and wagons left for Cumbria A parcel sent from the Bull & Mouth reaches Keswick in ten days; – others have often been from three to five weeks. Robert Southey to William Taylor

December 15,1815
Sequence Lat, Long Place Description Observed Commentary Source
7 ##.#####, ##.##### 50 Albemarle Street John Murray, publisher I went to Murray, & convinced him that the character of the Review was at stake. [Ed. A controversy over a review by Southey in the Quarterly Review.] Robert Southey to Charles Watkin Williams Wynn

8 51.50644531, -0.08819103241 London Bridge Current London Bridge built in 1970s. [Arrived at noon] crossed over at once into the city

11 51.5102716, -0.1214075089 Strand To find our house. They referred us elsewhere, being full.
Coliseum to Capitoline
11 ##.#####, ##.##### 25 Craven St. Melville's residence while in London Secured rooms at last. . . . Very cheap.
Capitoline to Pincian Hill

12 51.5071619, -0.126291 Queen Queen Hotel in St. Martin Went down to Queen's Hotel to inquire about our ship friends.
Capitoline to Pincian Hill
Alternate Capitoline to Pincian Hill
12 ##.#####, ##.##### Paternoster Row Visits a bookstore inquired for [Redburn] . . .offered . . .at a guinea
Capitoline to Pincian Hill
Alternate Capitoline to Pincian Hill
12 ##.#####, ##.##### Drury Lane Theatre Popular name of Theatre Royal in Catherine St east of Covent Garden, a 2-mile walk from Queen Hotel. a great crowd, & fine music [...] at Julien's Promenade Concerts Went to Drury Lane [Ed. Louis Antoine Jullien (1812-60) held his "concerts d'hiver" at the Theatre Royal, Drury Lane.]
Capitoline to Pincian Hill
